text.0: when thus like flame from far away maruts ye cast your measure forth.
text.1: to whom go ye to whom o shakers of the earth moved by whose wisdom whose design.
text.2: strong let your weapons be to drive away your foes firm for resistance let them be.
text.3: yea passing glorious must be your warrior might not as a guileful mortals strength.
text.4: when what is strong ye overthrow and whirl about each ponderous thing.
text.5: heroes your course is through the forest trees of earth and through the fissures of the rocks.
text.6: consumers of your foes no enemy of yours is found in heaven or on the earth.
text.7: ye rudras may the strength held in this bond be yours to bid defiance even now.
text.8: they make the mountains rock and reel they rend the forestkings apart.
text.9: onward ye maruts drive like creatures drunk with wine ye gods with all your company.
text.10: ye to your chariot have yoked the spotted deer a red deer as a leader draws.
text.11: even the earth herself listened as ye came near and men were sorely terrified.
text.12: o rudras quickly we desire your succour for this work of ours.
text.13: come to us with your aid as in the days of old so now for frightened kaṇvas sake.
text.14: should any monstrous foe o maruts sent by you or sent by mortals threaten us.
text.15: tear ye him from us with your power and with your might and with the succours that are yours.
text.16: for ye the worshipful and wise have guarded kaṇva perfectly.
text.17: o maruts come to us with full protecting help as lightning flashes seek the rain.
text.18: whole strength have ye o bounteous ones perfect earthshakers is your might.
text.19: maruts against the poets wrathful enemy send ye an enemy like a dart.
